comment: Very good class, her tests and quizzes are fair and as long as you go to class you'll be fine.

Took over summer, she is one of the best professors i've had at KSU, very lenient on grades. If you score low on any exam, your grade on the final can replace it. The summer semester is very short and i was worried it'd be tough to learn everything, but it was not, she is a good teacher and provides many resources.

This was a summer class. She had clearly not taught this class in awhile. rushed lectures which made conceptual questions hard. D2L was hard to navigate. Exams were rough, does not give enough practice exams/questions. gave a ton of worksheets (not graded) which were nice, but did not help much on exams. Expected you to know the material beforehand

Professor K was the best lab instructor I've had so far! I highly recommend taking her class if you can. She was very considerate and not a harsh grader at all. Also, she works out examples of the math problems in the lab reports which is super helpful. Content wise, 1212 lab is more difficult than 1211 lab, but the labs were more fun in 1212.

This is my third time taking this class and my first time understanding. She is great at explaining on a level that is understandable. Plus she gives us all of her notes. If you want to learn chemistry this is one of the best professors.

If you want to pass Chem 1212 take this professor. She gives you notes to complete in class which is amazing. There are also tons of study materials given. If you do the practice exams and the worksheets you will pass with no problem. Wish she taught OChem.

Very easy class and she means well, but most classes she just rambles about things like learning styles and stuff, she's one of those people that's overly obsessed with “classifying” people and it kinda irks me

Chem 2 is a fairly complex class, any rating under a 5 is a direct indication of that, because prof Kammerdiener is phenomenal. To say she provides a lot of resources is an understatement, she supplies you with EVERYTHING you need to succeed in the course. DO THE HOMEWORK AND WORKSHEETS. She made the course interesting and enjoyable, take her!

Chem 2 is extremely difficult and I believe any rating of her below a 5 is a reflection of that. I've never had a professor who offered more resources or cared more about her student's success. Recorded lectures, handwritten notes, slides, practice tests, study guides, and more. If you have to take Chem 2, she is phenomenal.

The lab is heavy and too many activities for the lab including graphics she also dismiss you from the class for every little thing, there is a bit of miscommunication when explaining the homework's to the students, she does not guide you through the process and when you ask she tells you that she is not baby sitting students so be prepare.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: This class is very difficult due to her tests being mostly free responses in a formula heavy class. We also had to watch all lectures before we got to class because she only does practice problems in class with one or two mentions of the lecture. She gives you a lot of practice and homework is for completion with answer key. Very tough

The tests were difficult, there is no curve. You will have difficulty if you are not good at chemistry or are a chemistry major. There were group quizzes for each unit and attendance was graded by a short quiz given at the beginning of each class.
Very fair grader. Has help sheets available for most of the labs. Explains everything well.

She has in-person group quizzes and online individual quizzes. Group quizzes are extra credit. There are daily attendance quizzes that you need to show up to class to complete. Tests are online except for the final. Smartworks homework is graded for completion and is due on the last day of class. Her notes are really good.

Professor K. is very nice. I loved that when the class was struggling she would push back our deadlines and did not take off points for late work. This class is an easy "A". The only con for this class is there is so much group work. One bad partner made my all of projects hell and one of the projects you worked on for the whole semester.
The course is difficult so make sure you study! Gives you a very little curve. Overall, she's a pretty average teacher not the best but you have the opportunity to pass if you work hard.
Professor Kammerdiener is a good teacher but she isn't a great teacher which makes a huge difference. She's a sweet teacher but I feel like things could've been better.

She was great for SCM. While it is a very heavy on group projects and solo activities which span over the entire semester so make sure you have good group members it was overall easy just make sure you stay up to date with the assignments and you'll be fine.

This was a summer course so it was very fast but she gave each topic adequate time and covered it fully. She was able to break down topics and explain them for anyone who needed it. She truly wants everyone to do well and gives us all the resources needed to succeed.

Professor was great, only issue was communicating through email, but I would just ask in class and be okay. There was always a pre-lab quiz and you had to have your lab in your notebook before class which was a lot of work. She said she would take off points for not having the write-up but never did. She did well explaining before we got started.

She gave us a ton of resources like worksheets to help. In class she works through all the problems so we understand how to do them. There is homework but it is completion graded. Attendance is not mandatory but needed if you want to pass because of the problem-solving. She cares and will meet with you anytime possible, not just in office hours.

Professor Kammerdiener is very straightforward and kind. Every other week there is either a quiz or an exam that is online w/lockdown browser. The questions are all things you should've seen before, either from in-class problems or the available worksheets. hw is completion and there's a group quiz once a month for 5 extra credit points. SI helpful

She's okay, I didn't attend class, I just learned the material online and by the many resources she had on D2L. Attendance was not mandatory which I liked. Just religiously practice many problems for the tests and quizzes and you're going to be okay. I'd retake her class since she's a chill prof. no extra credit or curves on tests though.
She's an okay lecturer but also a right wing conspiracy nut

Dropped out last semester because I knew I was going to fail (I procrastinated) but I'm retaking her class because she's a nice and chill professor. She gives a lot of practice problems which helps, and she uploads her notes after class.

Amazing professor!! She is so sweet and cares for us! Always willing to be flexible on deadlines and understands we have a life outside of classes! Graded by projects, no tests! Easy class and love this professor! Would definitely take her again!
Such a wonderful professor for SCM, I will be taking her again for chemistry! Really sweet and explains topics really well! My favorite lecture for Fall Semester 2022.

Prof.K is an ok professor. She gives us so many projects on top of our major project. We end up having 1-2 projects on top of the big project and are lost on when everything is due. We do not meet on fridays which is nice. If you do not like group projects, presenting,TONS of guest speakers, and interacting with your peers do not take this class.

She is a very solid choice for Chemistry 2. The tests are toned down so that is it not impossible. The quizzes are easy and you get get a lot of points added on by coming to class to do the group portion of the quiz. Nothing but good comments about her, and she is very easy to talk to. Totally worth going to Marietta campus to take her.

Overall, she was a good professor to have. She was very understanding about the group projects and we had fun. However, I did not like the fact that she called me out in front of the class for not doing an assignment. I felt it was unprofessional and it was humiliating. She also did that to another student as well. Other than that, good professor!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. K is the best teacher ever!You will love her class. Attendance is mandatory, if you have more than three absences you will fail. She is very chill and will help you with anything. You learn very interesting things in her class and you will have great guest speakers. You have a lot of group projects, so get ready to make friends.

Professor K is by far my favorite professor. She is clearly knowledgeable in what she teaches and was able to communicate and teach in a way that wasn't overwhelming. She is clear and concise, and great at what she does. I cannot recommend her enough!

I liked Prof K a lot, she was really nice and caring. The lectures and ppts were all posted online & she went over a bunch of practice problems in class. There were 5 quizzes and 5 tests and the ACS final. The final was super hard imo. She drops the lowest grade. Be sure to do the smartwork hw!!!

The lectures aren't the easiest or most informational on their own. Prof usually expects you to watch the powerpoints at home to go along with the lectures, which is where some people get the idea that her lectures aren't informational enough. I just watched short YT videos to go along with them and got a fairly easy A. Easy grader.

Professor K. is very polite and well versed in chemistry, but is terrible at teaching. They have trouble teaching a 50-minute class, often skip most of the PowerPoint during lecture, or seem as if they are reading the PowerPoint for the first time. You'll be teaching yourself this course, average grade for tests was failing, barely any curve.

We were the "guinea pig" lab because we didn't have a final exam and instead had a final project/presentation. Prof K is awesome. Just make sure you wear lab attire and show up on time. She barely looked at the notebook other than to check that you wrote the lab in it. Would take her again if I had another Chem class left.

Professor K is an amazing chemistry professor. I was forced to go to Marietta to take the lab because others were full, but I am glad I did because she was awesome. Very helpful, explained every lab thoroughly before starting. Never took more than 1:15 hours to complete a lab. EXTREMELY easy notebook grader, not harsh at all, wear pants and get A!

Shes soooo sweet I love her. definitely take this is you have to take SCM. workload is light and everything is easy and shes understanding so if u miss a due date she may extend it it depends but dont do it habitually. TAKE HER FOR SCM
rating_tags: Group projects--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Her lectures were recorded and also given in class but not in as much detail. She would just hit the main stuff and then work a ton of problems with us. She also gave practice test which really helped. The homework was for completion but do it because you have to at least complete it to get the completion grade.

No homework really, just mostly group projects. Be prepared to do presentations. She is really nice and flexible about due dates. Do not miss more than 5 classes or you will automatically receive an F for this course. About 5 projects and 5 assignments total.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Kammerdiener is super chill and a very sweet lady. This class was for sure an easy A. She also extends due dates too. However, she is very vague when it comes to assignments and projects.

Prof. K is a great lab teacher and she is super chill. She makes sure you understand each lab and is always there to help. In my opinion, she is one of the best general chem lab teachers at the university. I'd definitely recommend her if you want a lab prof without all the hassle.

She is willing to help you in or out of class. We worked a lot of examples in class which were very helpful. Exams and quizzes were well reviewed and straight forward so no big surprises. Will definitely take for chem 1212.
She's a very nice teacher. There are many group projects, some include presentations some do not. However, most of them are very easy as long as your group works together. Definitely recommend.

Amazing professor. I have had trouble turning in an assignment and didn't turn it in until about a week later, she still gave me full credit. She is open to moving due dates around. Group projects are the main thing in this class but everything is an easy A ! :)

Love Mrs. K. Attendance is key for her class, because if you do not show up, you can not pass, It is just her requirements. But, her class is super easy, and most of time in class, you are just going to talk, it isn't hardcore or boring. She is the best professor and super happy I got her, she made me less stressed! So, Just go to class and ur good
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This class was hard and it could be because Chemistry has always been a struggle for me. What I liked, however, was that she provided tons of extra non-graded work for you to complete so you can really understand the material. She also did reviews before every exam which was a HUGE help!

This was an online lab class which is not the best situation but prof K made it better. She will help you and explain stuff over again until you get it without making you feel dumb. The online labs are a little hard but would definitely take again.

She is a good professor. Very knowledgeable, nice, and she is always willing to help if it is needed. She can be a little intimidating at first, but she is super nice. I struggle a little with chemistry, but an A is definitely attainable. Reading the textbook helped prepare for tests. She let us replace our test grades with the final.

Professor Kammerdiener is the best I've ever had. I have always struggled with chemistry but with her help i made an A. I went to office hours all the time and asked for help when i needed it. If you show her you are trying you will do fine. She also replaces every test grade if you score higher on that section of the final. She's the best!!

This class was HARD for me. But she also made lectures interesting and fun. She really tries to connect with her students and if she were teaching chem 2 in the fall I would be the first one to sign up. At the beginning of the semester she tells you what you need to do to do well in the class. If you follow that you will make it through.

If you want to pass then take the lecture notes before class & do the worksheets she hands out. Mastering is optional but I HIGHLY recommend it. Tests are usually out of 20 questions and are concept based. Attendance is optional but dont skip. Practice as much as you can. Responds to emails so fast. Not too shabby
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: mrs. k was good because she gave us second chances on some of the quizzes and test. if you keep up and ask questions you will do good in this class. I am trying to take her for the second chem class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: prof K was great at helping us to understand what we was doing in lab. she would go over the lab sheets that we had to turn in to make sure we understood what we were supposed to do. just don't be late to lab or you will not get in.

she is one of the nicest professors i have ever had but i guess the material was just hard for me i don't know but it was not made very clear or understanding. She does care and is open for office hours even while were in quarantine currently. If you are good at chem then this would be a good teacher for you but I struggled big time.

Prof. Kammerdiener has been very helpful over this semester. With the switch to virtual she has made herself more available and provided recordings and feedback. She has allowed for retakes of tests to try and help boost grades during this time. She is always welcoming whenever you need help.

*UPDATE* COVID-19 made this class 10x harder material wise. The tests went from manageable to extremely difficult to complete. Use to be a great easy class. Theres a lot of grades for this class, but they are super easy to complete. There is a bunch of mastering assignments that are OPTIONAL which is great for practice without crushing your grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: She gives really helpful lectures before each lab. She is available to help during and after the labs. I had to miss two labs due to emergencies. If you give her adequate notice she will let you make it up by participating in her another one of her sections. She is super nice and personable. Fair and clear grader. Her final was fair and moderate.

Not a tough professor. She's approachable and works with you. Did not grade harshly. ACS was def hard tho. Harder than I thought so thats what killed my grade. She drops two quizzes and one lab report. None of which take too much time. I always did mine the night before and the day they were due.

Professor Kammerdiener is the perfect example of an average professor. She gives a lot of extra credit towards the final and an opportunity to replace all your test grades. Her lectures aren't great or terrible they're simply ok. One positive/negative is there are a lot of "quizzes" that you take throughout her class. I'd say 50+.
